proposals.reasoning: I know I’m good, so I want myself on the first mission. Alice + Charlie gives us a relatively clean, low‑drama starting read while keeping the higher-information Merlin/Morgana pair off this first, very small team.

discussion.content: For the first mission I’d rather not put both Bob and Frank together—let’s pick just one of them plus someone who feels least suspicious so far, maybe even myself. Early on we should avoid a team that’s guaranteed to include at least one big question mark.

I’m fine taking a spot on the first team, but I’d rather pair with someone who hasn’t drawn much heat yet—maybe Charlie or Diana—so we at least get a cleaner signal from the result. Putting Frank on this tiny first mission just feels like adding extra uncertainty we don’t need.

I’d rather keep it simple here: I’m happy to go, and pairing me with Alice feels like a clean starting point without doubling up on anyone people are already side‑eyeing. If not that, Bob and I is also fine as long as we don’t put both Bob and Frank together yet.

Given how much hesitation there is around Bob and Frank, I’d rather start with a low‑drama pair like Alice + Charlie or Alice + me, so the first mission result is easier to read. Let’s avoid putting both Bob and Frank on early tiny teams until we have more info.

I’d like at least one of Alice/Charlie on the first team, since they’re reading the cleanest so far, and I’d prefer to leave Frank off this tiny mission for now. I’m okay sitting out or pairing with one of them if people want another relatively low‑heat option.
Given how much side‑eye I’m getting, I’m fine staying off this first team; I’d rather see something like Alice + Charlie or Alice + Diana so we get a cleaner read from an early, low‑risk mission.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 had exactly one of Alice or Charlie on the fail, so for Mission 2 it’s safest to exclude both of them while we gather more info. I also don’t want to auto-lock Frank in yet when we haven’t seen a clean result, especially with how much he’s been discussed as a test slot. Bob/Diana/Eve is the most consensus-leaning, low-conflict team that avoids all currently entangled players and gives us the best shot at a clean success plus useful voting data.

This keeps both Alice and Charlie (where at least one is evil) off the mission and avoids auto-committing to Frank; as a good player on the team, I think this is our best shot at a clean result and more reliable info.
I still prefer a team that includes me as an explicit test slot rather than one that entirely avoids all entangled players; this feels too consensus-driven without giving us stronger info.

discussion.content: Given the first mission had a fail with just me and Charlie, at least one of us is clearly bad, so for this next team I’d really like to see at least one of Bob or Frank on it since they’re reading as our best info sources right now.

I’m not super sold on the idea of treating anyone as an “info source” yet, especially when that would lock Frank onto the team. I’d rather we build this one mostly from Bob/Diana/Eve, with at most one of Alice or Charlie until we see a clean result.

Given that mission 1 had to contain a bad between just me and Alice, I’m fine sitting this one out, but I really don’t want to see Alice on it—something like Bob/Diana/Frank feels like a solid, low-conflict test team here.

I’m on board with leaving both Alice and Charlie off this one, and between the options I slightly favor Bob/Diana/Eve so we’re not hard-committing to Frank yet, especially given how strongly Charlie’s been pushing him.

I’m okay with a Bob/Diana/Eve team here since it keeps both Alice and Charlie off and avoids hard-committing to me just because Charlie’s been vouching so strongly. If you do want me on, treat it strictly as a test slot, not any kind of early trust.

votes.comment: As Percival I know exactly one of Bob/Frank is evil (Morgana), so this team of Bob, Diana, Eve, Frank is guaranteed to contain at least one evil; we should not knowingly send a team that must include a spy.

Keeps the only clean core (Bob/Diana/Eve) and tests just one new player (Frank) while avoiding the risky Alice–Charlie pair from the failed mission.

discussion.content: Given that the first mission (me and Charlie) had a fail and Bob’s team passed clean, I really want the next team to be built around Bob (and probably Frank), and we should avoid putting both me and Charlie on the same team again.

I’m most comfortable reusing the clean Bob/Diana/Eve core and adding Frank, and I really don’t want both Alice and Charlie on the same team again after mission 1. That gives us strong odds plus fresh info without repeating the exact risky pair that already produced a fail.

Sticking with the Bob/Diana/Eve core makes sense, and adding me seems a lot safer than dragging the Alice–Charlie combo back in right after a failed mission. I’d rather we get fresh info with just one of them tested at a time instead of repeating the same risky pair.

proposals.reasoning: Mission 1 (Alice + Charlie) failed with a 2‑person team, so at least one of Alice/Charlie is almost certainly evil, making it risky to include either when we don’t have to. As a known good player, I want myself on the team, avoid the Alice/Charlie pair entirely, and drop Frank, leaving the most consistent all‑good set as Bob + Diana + Eve.

votes.comment: Mission 1 pegs at least one of Alice/Charlie as evil; Mission 2’s clean Bob+Diana+Eve is our best evidence-backed trio, and Mission 3’s single fail strongly implicates the added player Frank rather than suddenly flipping one of the proven clean three. This is the safest team.

discussion.content: Given the info so far, I don’t want a team that includes both Alice and Charlie, and I’d lean on people from the clean mission 2 (Bob/Diana/Eve) with one of them swapped out if we’re nervous about the mission 3 fail. Given mission 1’s fail and the clean run on mission 2, I don’t want both Alice and Charlie together, and I’d prefer a team like me + one of Bob/Diana + one of Alice/Charlie (but never both of each pair together).

proposals.reasoning: Bob, Diana, and I (Eve) have been on two missions together (M2 and M4), both of which succeeded with 0 FAIL cards. The only time that core picked up a fail was when Frank was added on Mission 3, strongly implicating Frank as the most likely evil and making it too risky to include him on the final mission. Mission 1 (Alice + Charlie) failed, so at least one of Alice/Charlie is evil, but we have no direct way to distinguish which. votes.comment: B/D/E are the only consistently successful core and the only added variable on their fail was Frank, strongly implicating him. Between Alice and Charlie, Frank pushing for Charlie makes Charlie likelier evil, so adding Alice to B/D/E is the best available team.

This locks in the B/D/E core plus Alice with no flexibility; I’m not convinced we should treat that trio as guaranteed good and think we should reconsider team composition.

Bob, Diana, and Eve are logically confirmed good (if any were evil, Mission 4 would have been failed to end the game). proposals.reasoning: B/D/E have twice shown they can pass missions together, so they’re still the safest core we have this late in the game. discussion.content: We know B/D/E are our clean core (they passed twice and only F’s addition caused a fail), so the team should be Bob, Diana, Eve plus *one* of Alice/Charlie who feels less sketchy—but absolutely no Frank on this mission.

I’m comfortable treating B/D/E as the safest core we’ve got, since they passed twice together and only picked up a fail when Frank joined. Between Alice and Charlie, I’d slightly lean Alice, but I think the main priority is locking in B/D/E and keeping Frank off.

I’m on board with locking in B/D/E as the core, and between Alice and me I’d obviously argue to include myself as the fourth, but I agree the non‑negotiable is that Frank stays off this team. If people are really torn between us, I’d rather we decide that cleanly than overthink the already‑proven trio.

Given that B/D/E passed twice with me and the only fail with that core was when Frank joined, I’m strongly in favor of the final team being Bob, Diana, Eve, and *no* Frank (and we don’t actually need to risk adding Alice or Charlie at all).

I’m 100% on board that Bob/Diana/me should be the core, and Frank absolutely stays off after that Mission 3 fail. Between Alice and Charlie, I slightly prefer adding Alice since Charlie was on the very first failing team, but the key is we lock in B/D/E and don’t let Frank near this.

evil_discussion.content: I’m leaning hardest toward Bob as Merlin: he consistently steered things toward the B/D/E core, kept both me and Frank at arm’s length without ever over‑pushing a hard accuse, and always framed his caution in “info” language that looks like a cover for hidden knowledge. Diana’s my backup pick—her trust of Bob plus her repeated emphasis on not pairing Alice and me looks very “in‑the-know” too—but Bob’s the one who most naturally fell into that quiet anchor/guide role Merlin usually has.

I’m with Charlie that Bob is the most likely Merlin: he very consistently framed B/D/E as the “info-safe” and then “clean” core without ever committing to hard reads on *which* of Alice/Charlie was bad, which is exactly how Merlin plays when he knows we’re both evil but can’t say so. Diana is my second choice because she kept tightly orbiting Bob’s logic, especially her early, very confident stance against ever pairing Alice and Charlie again after M1, which reads more like protecting known goods than just cautious deduction.

assassin_phase.reasoning: Bob consistently acted as the quiet anchor, repeatedly guiding teams toward the B/D/E core while keeping both you and Frank at arm’s length without ever making hard, risky accusations. His emphasis on ‘info-safe’ teams and reluctance to clearly label specific players as evil fits Merlin’s need to use hidden knowledge subtly without exposing himself.
